title: (x) mod sans "net" - Coolvetica {Dave W}
content:
Hey,

I’ve seen this t before, but have no clue what it is. Please help. Similar fonts are welcome too...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111129im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_net.jpg)
author: peter_monrad

comments.content:
Ray Larabie’s “Coolvetica”?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/coolvetica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111129/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/coolvetica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/coolvetica/")

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster’s stopped working.
[Chalet New York 1980](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111129/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts) by House Industries is similar

There is a ’t’ like that in House Gothic and also House Chalet Tokyo. However the ’ne’ do not match House Gothic or Chalet.

- Mike Yanega

I’d guess that Eurostile is the inspiration for the t and is similar.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20090807111129/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eurostile "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=eurostile")

Tim
I believe dtw is correct. It is Coolvetica.
